I am looking at using ai to grade student work experimentally next year one advantage is if i publish the grading prompt with the assignment then the student can test out their submission the grading prompt and can get their feedback before they actually hit submit and if they dont like the result they can attempt to revise before it ever gets to me taken over a typical lab report turnaround time for me of weeks this has huge advantages by the time the students get my comments without ai the vast majority just look at the number dont care about any well intentioned this is how you could do better next time type feedback i would love to never have to include numbers at all and simply make the role of teacher more of a deliberate practice coach role instead of the presumed judgejuryexecutioner role that being a numbergiver makes me letting the ai do the number part might reduce the adversarial nature of the teache relationship also the implied debate by the op of who is working harder the student or the teacher feels a little insulting the student writes one report i grade reports of course the perassignment effort has never been equalfair ps if i actually do this next year i will always offer to regrade by hand if a student requests it from my testing of gpt so far it is definitely fallible.

I do wonder if part of the issue is that i am working remotely for a more rural company in the midwest my design style is more modern i might just not be lining up with the more outdated design styles locals are accustomed to should i look for a job in a bigger city where my style would fit in more im just at a loss my workload has gotten to be so much that i dont even have a moment to think about these feelings i have been asking for another designer on the team for a while to no avail it sounds like youre just trying to design more to your personal tastes than what the project or client actually want or need so the notion of trying to find a job to fir that style seems more like avoiding the real issue which is that you should be able to design to the project not just only take projects that fit to your style designers having a style is often misled or exaggerated anyway as while we all definitely do have our own styles and preferences it will often manifest more in subtle ways at least to laymen or something like preferring more typographic solutions versus more illustrative ones so when you say your style is more modern i think that needs to be defined in terms of how rigid it is or what it really means if it means youre more oriented towaards trends thats typically a weakness in itself but you can also approach many different styles and aesthetics with a more contemporary sensibility such that its more a hybrid than anything now every client rejects my logos and it seems i cant do anything right it has gotten to the point where we cant finish a single branding project ultimately your solution has to achieve the goals and objectives stated at the onset of the project when people have issues being on the same page as a client assuming its not a whole committee of people that never works it usually means the designer didnt discuss the project enough before beginning work andor works too far ahead without further discussion.

Introduction this analysis attempts to construct a psychological profile of the reddit user dsalvat based solely on a sample of their comment history on the platform given the limited dataset this profile should be considered speculative though grounded in textual evidence the goal is to analyze patterns in language interests social interaction style and emotional tone to infer potential personality traits and background information about this individual language and tone analysis the language used by dsalvat is generally casual conversational and straightforward there is frequent use of profanity slang emojis and sarcasm indicating a tendency towards informal modes of expression however the writing also shows proper spelling grammar and punctuation suggesting some care in crafting responses the tone of the comments trends negative cynical and hostile many comments express anger criticism or disagreement with the original post there appears to be an oppositional mindset with a tendency to argue against prevailing sentiments the tone frequently comes across as arrogant blunt and confrontational interests and beliefs analysis several interests and ideological leanings emerge from the comments there is substantial engagement with political topics particularly focused on criticism of conservative views and republican politicians the individual seems to hold strong liberalprogressive beliefs there is also significant discussion of cryptocurrencies indicating interest and perhaps investment in this area comments touch on blockchain platforms like ethereum cardano and celsius an affinity for new technologies and decentralization seems likely additionally an interest in psychology is indicated by the willingness to analyze someones personality based on limited data curiosity about human behavior appears present social interaction style analysis the predominant social interaction style is characterized by confrontation lecturing and oneupmanship there is a tendency to assert moral and intellectual superiority over others challenging and belittling opposing views is common empathy and understanding are rarely displayed there is more effort to prove oneself right than to genuinely engage however some comments do show capacity for humor and positive social norms such as not snitching on family overall the style seems egodriven displaying a need to appear smart justified and morally right however a degree of social awareness prevents completely antisocial behavior background information hypotheses the user seems highly engaged with american culture and politics references to political figures current events and local issues imply residence in the united states specifically an expertise in georgia state politics suggests potential roots in that region the technological knowledge and nuanced psychology analysis may indicate some universitylevel education the articulate writing style supports this as well a technologyoriented career seems plausible interest in investing points to likely adulthood with enough financial stability to engage in markets the informal tone suggests someone relatively young potentially between years old the user is likely male based on typical patterns in online tonestyle psychological traits inference the need to be right and intellectually superior points to narcissistic tendencies arrogance and egoism permeate the commentary however some selfawareness of these tendencies may be present the rigidly leftwing perspective indicates strong loyalty to ideology over nuance a judgmental stance stems from firm moral convictions potential for dogmatism exists argumentativeness and cynicism reflect a skeptical mistrusting view of the world suspicion of authority and defensiveness point to some neurotic undercurrents feelings of disempowerment may fuel compensatory intellectual elitism conclusion in conclusion this speculative psychological profile constructs the image of an argumentative politically cynical technologically oriented american male with dogmatic ideological views narcissistic tendencies and an intellectualized but insecure personality however given the limited dataset this interpretation should be taken as an exercise in profiling rather than an definitive assessment the gaps are many and the nuances of true human personality always exceed our theoretical models.

It really comes down to what your goal of an image is and if there are things which need to be corrected i do wedding photography edits which we have created a preset that we use to have a consistent style across all of our delivered images this basically amounts to not messing around with color calibration hsl or color grading in most situations sometimes mixed lighting calls for some hsl adjustments but our photographers are pretty good about using temperature gels on their flashes to match the existing lighting my goal when editing our wedding catalog images is to firstly remove distractions from the image when it comes to portraits the goal should be imo to draw the viewers eyes to the eyes of the subject youre limited on what you can do to achieve that in lightroom but if there are very distracting blemishes i remove those with spot removal if there is scarring on the face from acne ill typically use a mask with skin softening if its a scene where there is one guy in the corner of the image crop him out or spot remove him if you cant same goes with signs company logos or if our drone gets caught in a shot easy spot removes many times again its about eliminating distractions to ensure the focus is your subject beyond that depending on the image you can do other things with masks to add to the image if its a dance floor and you have a subject in the center busting some sick moves who is surrounded by a bunch of people a slight vignette either with a mask or in the postcrop vignette can make everyone around the subject less distracting and make your subject pop out more if its an environmental portrait subjects are there but the environment theyre in is spectaculathe purpose of the image you could add a textureclarity mask to the environment to make it pop more as well just to run down i guess how often i use the tools for my editing croprotation almost every time more or less mostly just straightening but cropping in to center subjects is frequent as well spot removal somewhat infrequently maybe of images red eye removal almost never we use off camera flash so rarely do we get red eyes you normally see red eye from flashes that are directly above the lens pop up flashes masking somewhere around of the time probably really depends on what i am editing if its one of our image weddings with edits less than if its a preweddingengagement shoot thats stylized probably of images white balance probably of images normally its copied and pasted between similar scenes kinda depends on the photographer and whether or not they actually used their colored gel or not on their flash tone of images something is changed in here we use a preset like i said but every image is different so these need to be adjusted i find myself changing exposure highlights and shadows the most presence rarely adjust these since if i want moreless textureclarity i achieve it through masking and dehaze is very situational vibrance and saturation isnt messed with often since it mostly contributes to the style we produce tone curve never it again contributes to our style from the preset hsl very rarely only when there is mixed lighting to correct for yellows or blues color grading never detail sharpening and luminance i mess with most of the time its just copied between images but sometimes i tweak it further if a very high iso was used and its a must keep moment lens corrections rarely adjust usually just keep remove chromatic aberrations and enable profile corrections turned on unless keeping profile corrections off adds to the image if the image isnt cropped much or at all and it produces a more natural looking vignette than postcrop vignette more commonly though i find myself going into manual under lens corrections to defringe purples or greens using the eye dropper its still somewhat rare but its more often than adjusting the other options transform not too often but depending on the lens being used and if there is a lot of geometry that cant be straightened with the crop tool i will attempt an auto upright adjustment and if that doesnt produce good results ill try guided sometimes i manually transform vertical or horizontal but very rarely effects rarely mess with these other than sometimes post crop vignette grain i never mess with since its adjusted with our preset calibration never this would be the off the top of my head quickly thought read on where i spent my time editing images on a large scale i used to be responsible for editing our large scale catalogs for hours per week but now i just do highlights for the most part since i have moved into a manager of admins position or whatever the hell i am lmao.

Sup actual animator here d just so you know your eyes cannnt really tell the difference between and fps well most people cant and after fps all the frames are blurring together the way the real world does and your brain is basically only using like of the frames being displayed it still looks a little smoother but yeah if you snuck in images unrelated to the rest of an animation at fps you wouldnt see them most of the time if it was just frame anime was where animators pioneered the concepts of variable framerates unlike western animations where there was a constant push for more frames most disney films were hitting fps by the end of the s the variable framerates existed initially because of the sheer cost of doing smoother animations it allowed you to drop the framerates in areas where high frame rate would be not noticed gradually as the animators gained more skill it was used to better and better effect if you look at scenes in anime where they are having a conversation you will often see that much of a scene is not even animated at all other than the mouth and eyes now typically as animators we understand that when somethings not moving it looks dead it is a credit to japanese animators that they manage to maintain the illusion with such few fps as the s came to an end everyone began switching to computer generated workflows disney producing stuff like beauty and the beast with d software shows like southpark started using flash studio instead of the laboriously cut out paper figures they had previously been using as a result of computer software advances anime and production costs dropped but by then the anime style of somewhat limited and variable framerates had been established so now days you will see many modern anime still running as low as fps during some scenes not because they cant do fps but because it lets them get out episodes rather than episodes in the same time frame but its also part of the anime style to animate in that way anyway interestingly higher framerates actually make d animation look worse generally among animators fps and fps are preferred over higher framerates which quickly start to look like a technique called rotoscoping and because they get so close to looking like real life traced by a pen it starts to sit in a kind of d uncanny valley that just looks strange xb as for cg anime that looks crap usually those are done by super low budget productions all anime is produced on a computer now the cheap stuff is done in d software with shaders because why pay an animator to draw something d from another angle when you can just move a d model yeh its kinda silly i have no doubt ai is swiftly going to be entering animation and film production pipelines although the whole copyright thing is a major issue it is likely studios will have to create their own models before they can be used so that they own the copyright on the images the model is trained upon xb anyway fps doesnt mean anything if the script is terrible there is some amazing anime done with very limited budgets that easily stands up to stuff from bigger budget studios xb the more you know d.

Ive read some of the papers on googles computational photography and its much more complicated than you think ill give some examples hdr this is essentially taking about photos number might vary between versions phone etc but the early number was i believe the photos are not at different exposures though that could have changed since this paper released too the photos are taken in in zero shutter lag mode as in theyre captured instantaneously think like a frame video clip the photos are then stacked and aligned if theres any ghosting from moving objects ai erases it an algorithm then brightens shadows in some frames darkens highlights in others increases saturation etc but the unintended side effect here is that noise is reduced because noise is reduced iso can be boosted higher than it normally would so they can capture those shadows the idea being that noise is random and if you stack enough photos youll eventually cover the pixels that contain noise with the parts of the image you want night sight this is actually an evolution of hdr its literally the same exact concept as hdr but they use about photos instead of this is why you have to stay still during capture theyre counting on there to be enough data in photos to remove the noise in order to produce the photo samsungs use of pixel binning im not sure if any standard cameras use this or not but im leaning towards not at the moment other manufacturers might use this as well not just samsung this is a benefit of using a super high mp camera sensor for instance the note g i used to own had a mp camera the ultra had higher resolution sensor and saw even more benefits if you shot in the mp mode instead of the mp mode the phone used pixel binning this is a process in which the pixels would be combined to form fewer but larger pixels thus the mp mode larger pixels means better color less noise etc photos simply looked better with pixel binning vs high resolution on a smartphone if you shoot in raw you Quick primer on ai safety just go through the whole playlist by robert miles but is boils down to utility function and goal alignment if you build an asi and you dont align it in a safe way then you effectively have a super intelligent agent in the world that will work to optimize the world towards what ever its utility function happens to be at all costs if humans have competing interest that are in conflict with its goal then asi will seek a solutions the minimize human interference in its goal the hard part about all this is the ai system are more grown then built we define proxy goals and they we score how well the agent does at the task if it does well nothing happen if it fails gradient decent tweaks the network by adjusting the activation weights on the nodes in the hidden layers this is more or less a dumb optimization algorithm similar to evolution but you selecting for functionality that is able to pass what ever your testing metric is this is sort of fine for weaker models like gpt if gpt is misaligned the worst your going is the model that starts to give unhinged text output a misaligned asi is far worse because you can run into a scenario that the model does have a perfect understanding of the intended goals but the model goals are misaligned and it knows that seeking to fallow its own goal will lead to termination so it pretends to be what we want until it finds a solutions to free itself.

Just to clarify the one with noisegrain is the original correct worth pointing out grain will help relieve the banding in your second image and is a common tactic in achieving smooth gradation you mentioned vector ill just point out that the grain will require an element of rasterisation to achieve though the underlying effect is not impossible to achieve via vector lets take a crack at this many ways to achieve this but lets do it in a format that allows you to easily edit it on the fly as usual the key is to break the problem down into steps to work our way through it up first the underlying gradation in vector you have some options for this straight up gradient a mesh or a blend meshes will be too finnicky for you i suspect and blends whilst is probably the way i would do it will be too tricky so lets stick with nice easy gradients additively step get the colours and make them global swatches for your first one its orange yellow and violet make those now we are going to make duplicates of the circle with radial gradients going from colour to transparency like so you will need to play with the gradient handlesdimensionsdistribution accordingly to get it how you want but dont worry youll get a chance to tweak this later i made a yellow one a violet broad one and a tight violet one to pick up the outer glow area step time to go to photoshop copy your finished ball and drop it in as a smart object this will let you tweak it apply guassian blue to get it like image next step is optional but i then converted that into a smart object again and applied field blur blur gallery with grain as it makes the grain to black nicely but you could just as easily use a grain overlay i note that the yellow section in example has no grain you could softly maskblur that out if you wanted to achieve it step now you can play to your hearts content with colour go into your smart object and adjust your global swatches to suit ive included a random one i did for demo is it
